name: TestScript Example Search Observation
description: TestScript example resource with simple Observation search test. The read tests will utilize user defined dynamic variables that will hold the Observation search parameter values.

link.description: Demographics and other administrative information about an individual or animal receiving care or other health-related services.

variable.name: ObservationSearchCode
variable.description: Enter Observation search criteria for a known code

variable.name: ObservationSearchStatus
variable.description: Enter Observation search criteria for a known status

variable.name: ObservationSearchBundleTotal
variable.description: Evaluate the returned Observation searchset Bundle.total value

operation.description: Test simple search to verify server support.

assert.description: Confirm that the request url contains the code search parameter.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned resource type is Bundle.
Confirm that the returned Bundle correctly defines the navigation links.

test.name: Observation Create Search
test.description: Create a Observation resource and capture the returned HTTP Header Location. Then search for (read) that Observation using the Location URL value and validate the response.

operation.description: Create a Observation resource and capture the returned HTTP Header Location.

assert.description: Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 201(Created).
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Location is present.

operation.description: Read the created Observation using the captured Location URL value.

assert.description: Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned resource type is Observation.

test.name: Observation Search Dynamic
test.description: Search for Observation resources using the user defined dynamic variables ${ObservationSearchCode} and ${ObservationSearchStatus} and validate response.

operation.description: Search for Observation resources on the destination test system.

assert.description: Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned format is XML.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Bundle.
Confirm that the returned Bundle conforms to the base FHIR specification.
Confirm that the returned Bundle type equals 'searchset'.
Confirm that the returned Bundle total is greater than or equal to the number of returned entries.
